meaningMnemonic: A <radical>badger</radical>, at the <radical>root</radical> of its <radical>heart</radical>, is a <kanji>courteous</kanji> creature.
readingMnemonic: Badgers are especially <kanji>courteous</kanji> to <reading>con</reading>dors (こん). Condors live in the trees while badgers live in burrows under those trees. When humans tear down the condor's homes, the badgers who live below them always let them stay over until they get back on their feet.
